The core concepts inside of @mattereum are every bit as weird and discontinuous as the early days of @ethereum . It took us years to figure out how to tell the Eth story. Mat's been likewise slow. It's basically a legal API for Ethereum Smart Contracts to bind to physical property

Oh currency can't do that. e-Gold can't do that. That's why I ignored Bitcoin. Wrote about it to friends in 2012 telling them to buy, and then ignored it. I came out of crypto-retirement for Ethereum because smart contracts *can* build new social structure. But we need scaling!

Most of the early bitcoiners were dirt poor. That matters. Take a look at the 2013 talk I did, where I'm talking about how it's the first political activity I've seen that pays the rent of the people doing the activism. Unheard of since Russia 1913.
